Yes, CNN has used virtual reality to cover breaking news stories as well. One example is during the 2017 solar eclipse, where they live-streamed the event using a 360-degree camera, allowing viewers to experience the eclipse in virtual reality. 

In another instance, during Hurricane Harvey, CNN used virtual reality technology to provide real-time updates on the storm's impact in Houston. The 360-degree cameras placed on boats and helicopters allowed viewers to experience the disaster firsthand, providing a new level of immersion and understanding of the impact of the hurricane.

Therefore, CNN has successfully used virtual reality to cover breaking news stories, providing a more immersive and engaging way to deliver news updates to their audience.
